intro: Chrysanthemum khorasanicum, commonly known as the Persian chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various climates. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
